page.title: 07HISTORY of RHAYADER
page.content: The area has been inhabited since the Neolithic period and has documented history since 12th century,when there was a wooden castle and moat.The Rhayader Jewellery found on Gwastedyn Hill consists of 2nd or 3rd century Roman items in gold and is now kept in the British Museum. Rhayader became a Shire town by the Act of Union 1536 but lost this after the Judge was murdered in 1540. Due to its site the town became the main stopping point for Drovers driving animals to markets in England. This is the reason for the large number of inns in the town. The poor state of the Turnpike roads caused the Rebecca Riots in 1843 when the Tollgates were attacked.The main language until 18th century was Welsh decreasing steadily as trading with the English increased until present day when English is predominant.
